11.m: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly. - John 10:10 (ESV)

l.q: How did Jesus liken himself to a shepherd?
l.a: Jesus likened himself to a good shepherd. He knows His sheep, He even knows them by name. And His sheep knows Him too, and it is He that they follow. He gives his sheep life and they have it abundantly. He lays down His life for His sheep.

l.q: Which verses speak of Jesus being the savior of His sheep?
l.a: In verses 9-11, Jesus speaks of being the door where those who enter will be saved and will have abundant life. In contrast to the thief who only comes to steal and kill and destroy. But Jesus lays down his life for the sheep. And He is also given the authority by God to take it up again.

The sheep are those people who follow Jesus. Jesus speaks of other sheep who are not of this fold, but He will bring them also with Him. Israel is God's chosen people, but later on God caused the gospel to also spread to the Gentiles.

11.p: Thank you, Jesus, for caring for me like a good shepherd. Thank you for being my protection from the evil one. Thank you for the peace and the abundant life that you give.
